intro: Mouriri exadenia, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble a miniature star. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers are white and fragrant, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is edible, with a sweet and tangy flavor, making it a popular fruit in local markets.
